action.action-desc: Mr. Cuellar (for himself and Mr. McCaul) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To promote bilateral tourism through cooperation between the United States and Mexico.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the United States-Mexico Tourism Improvement Act of 2023.
It is the policy of the United States—

paragraph.text: to continue deepening bilateral tourism through governmental cooperation between the United States and Mexico;
to improve third-party tourism to the United States and Mexico through joint international promotional efforts; and
to seek to prioritize and expand the tourism industries in both countries by emphasizing exchanges in various international economic sectors, including relating to—

section.header: Strategy to expand bilateral tourism through cooperation with Mexico

subsection.text: The Secretary of State shall develop a strategy through the High Level Economic Dialogue (HLED) platform to carry out the bilateral tourism policy described in section 2 and to encourage the Government of Mexico to take reciprocal action relating to bilateral tourism.
The strategy required under subsection (a) shall—

paragraph.text: encourage more joint tourism initiatives between the United States and Mexico, including collaborations between governmental and nongovernmental entities; and

encourage United States and Mexican nonprofit institutions and private businesses to assist prospective and developing entrepreneurs in strengthening their business skills in the United States and Mexico.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall submit to Congress a report on the strategy required under subsection (a).
